decks.notes: The key concept of this Ruby Storm deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly through cards like Pyretic Ritual and Manamorphose, in order to cast multiple spells in a single turn and eventually win the game with a massive Grapeshot or Ral, Monsoon Mage. Additionally, the deck utilizes Past in Flames to recur key spells from the graveyard and continue the explosive combo. The deck also includes various card draw and filtering effects like Reckless Impulse and Glimpse the Impossible to ensure consistency in executing the combo.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and spells. The deck utilizes efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, along with powerful spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm, to quickly deal damage and control the board. The inclusion of cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Arena of Glory provide additional support and resilience to the deck. The deck also has some land disruption with cards like Blood Moon to disrupt opponent's mana base and gain an advantage.

The deck focuses on using the Broodscale Bloodchief combo to generate a huge amount of mana and cast Emrakul, the Promised End as quickly as possible. It includes cards like Sowing Mycospawn and Kozilek's Command to help ramp up mana production, while also utilizing cards like Malevolent Rumble and Eldrazi Temple to further boost the combo potential. The inclusion of Walking Ballista and Haywire Mite also provide additional options for dealing with opponents' threats. The deck aims to assemble the combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful black creatures and disruptive spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to use efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Kozilek's Command to control the board while playing threats like Emperor of Bones and Thought-Knot Seer to apply pressure. The deck also takes advantage of cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the inclusion of Urza's Saga and Mishra's Bauble provides additional card advantage and flexibility. Overall, the deck aims to win quickly through aggression and disruption.

The concept of this deck is to quickly assemble a board presence using artifacts and creatures with the affinity mechanic, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal spells. The deck aims to generate value through card draw and recursion with cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble, while also utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The combination of aggressive creatures, disruptive spells, and card advantage engines makes this deck a versatile and formidable force in the Modern format.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deploy artifacts onto the battlefield and use them to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga to generate mana and tokens, the deck can take advantage of powerful abilities like Pinnacle Emissary and Engineered Explosives to control the board and apply pressure. Emry, Lurker of the Loch provides card advantage and recursion, while Metallic Rebuke and Sink into Stupor offer disruption and protection. This deck aims to close out games swiftly through a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive spells.

This deck focuses on ramping mana quickly and efficiently to play big threats like Primeval Titan and Scapeshift. Amulet of Vigor helps to untap lands and get extra value out of bouncing lands like Gruul Turf and Simic Growth Chamber. The deck aims to generate a lot of mana and repeatedly search for lands with effects like Urza's Saga and Tolaria West, ultimately winning the game by either overwhelming the opponent with giant creatures or dealing a large amount of damage with Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and a bunch of Mountains.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful artifact synergies. By efficiently playing out artifacts like Mox Opal and Engineered Explosives, along with creatures like Kappa Cannoneer and Pinnacle Emissary, the deck aims to quickly close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. Cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga provide additional value and card advantage, while cards like Claws of Gix and Tormod's Crypt disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck thrives on tempo and resource efficiency to secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on creating an aggressive board presence by quickly deploying artifact creatures and utilizing artifacts to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures, artifact recursion, and disruptive spells. The key strategy is to leverage the synergy between artifact creatures, artifacts, and card draw to maintain pressure and control the game tempo. The deck's affinity for artifacts allows for explosive starts and resilient board presence, making it a versatile and powerful archetype in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. The key strategy is to maintain a fast pace of play, utilizing cards like Goblin Bombardment and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to deal direct damage while continuing to pressure the opponent with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls. The deck aims to control the board and maintain pressure to close out the game before opponents have a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this UR Storm deck is to quickly generate mana and card advantage through spells like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Pore Over the Pages. By efficiently digging through the deck with Impulse, Preordain, and Stock Up, the deck aims to set up a powerful combo turn utilizing Hidden Strings and Lotus Field for a massive amount of mana. The deck also utilizes Fae of Wishes to access sideboard options, while Lier, Disciple of the Drowned helps with graveyard recursion. Overall, the deck is designed to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, supported by cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge for additional damage. It also includes control elements like Blood Moon and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Seasoned Pyromancer and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide card advantage, while Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Arena of Glory boost the team's power. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient threats and prevent them from stabilizing.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and cheap spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures. By leveraging cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mox Opal, the deck aims to generate significant card advantage and board presence early in the game. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, the deck can apply pressure while also disrupting the opponent's strategy. Additionally, cards like Metallic Rebuke and Mishra's Bauble help to maintain tempo and disrupt the opponent's game plan, allowing the deck to maintain a strong presence on the battlefield.

The key strategy of this deck revolves around utilizing cards like Overlord of the Balemurk, Street Wraith, and Living End to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures. By casting Living End, the player can then bring all those creatures back onto the battlefield, overwhelming the opponent with a sudden surge of creatures. Generous Ent and Force of Negation provide protection and disruption, while cards like Endurance and Misty Rainforest help with deck manipulation. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and unleash a powerful board presence that can be difficult for the opponent to deal with.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Galvanic Discharge, and Phelia, along with powerful spells like Consign to Memory and Prismatic Ending to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Quantum Riddler provide additional card advantage and versatility. The deck also includes control elements like Solitude and Wrath of the Skies to deal with threats. The mana base is optimized to support the aggressive game plan while still being able to cast the deck's spells effectively. Overall, the deck aims to pressure the opponent while disrupting their strategy.

The main deck is focused on aggressively playing artifacts to overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Engineered Explosives and Arcbound Ravager, the deck aims to quickly build up a board presence and deal damage efficiently. Key cards such as Mox Opal and Urza's Saga help accelerate the deck's strategy, while Mishra's Bauble provides card advantage. The inclusion of Kappa Cannoneer and Pinnacle Emissary offer additional ways to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to be fast, resilient, and explosive in order to secure a quick victory.
